cases.description: Ensures that clients can correctly parse datetime (timestamps) with offsets

given.name: EmptyInputAndEmptyOutput
given.documentation:
The example tests how requests and responses are serialized when there's no request or response members.

While this should be rare, code generators must support this.

cases.description: Empty output
Ensures that clients can correctly parse datetime timestamps with fractional seconds

given.name: GreetingWithErrors
given.documentation:
This operation has three possible return values:

  1. A successful response in the form of GreetingWithErrorsOutput
  2. An InvalidGreeting error.
  3. A BadRequest error.

cases.description: Ensures that operations with errors successfully know how to deserialize the successful response

InvalidGreeting.documentation: This error is thrown when an invalid greeting value is provided.

given.name: GreetingWithErrors
given.documentation:
This operation has three possible return values:

  1. A successful response in the form of GreetingWithErrorsOutput
  2. An InvalidGreeting error.
  3. A BadRequest error.

cases.description: Parses simple XML errors

ComplexError.documentation: This error is thrown when a request is invalid.

given.name: GreetingWithErrors
given.documentation:
This operation has three possible return values:

  1. A successful response in the form of GreetingWithErrorsOutput
  2. An InvalidGreeting error.
  3. A BadRequest error.

given.name: IgnoresWrappingXmlName
given.documentation:
The xmlName trait on the output structure is ignored in AWS Query.

The wrapping element is always operation name + "Response".

cases.description: The xmlName trait on the output structure is ignored in the ec2 protocol

given.name: NoInputAndOutput
given.documentation:
The example tests how requests and responses are serialized when there's no request payload or response members.

While this should be rare, code generators must support this.

cases.description: Empty output
Serializes recursive structures
Serializes simple scalar properties
Supports handling NaN float values.
Supports handling Infinity float values.
Supports handling -Infinity float values.
Blobs are base64 encoded
Empty blobs are deserialized as empty string
Empty self closed blobs are deserialized as empty string
Deserializes empty XML lists

given.name: XmlEnums
given.documentation: This example serializes enums as top level properties, in lists, sets, and maps.

cases.description: Serializes simple scalar properties

given.name: XmlIntEnums
given.documentation: This example serializes intEnums as top level properties, in lists, sets, and maps.

cases.description: Serializes simple scalar properties

given.name: XmlLists
given.documentation:
This test case serializes XML lists for the following cases for both input and output:

  1. Normal XML lists.
  2. Normal XML sets.
  3. XML lists of lists.
  4. XML lists with @xmlName on its members
  5. Flattened XML lists.
  6. Flattened XML lists with @xmlName.
  7. Flattened XML lists with @xmlNamespace.
  8. Lists of structures.

cases.description: Tests for XML list serialization
Serializes XML namespaces
